title: End of Influence_ What Happens When Other Countries Have the Mon
description:
At the end of World War II, the United States had all the moneyÃ¢â‚¬â€and all the power. Now, America finds itself cash poor, and to a great extent power follows money. In The End of Influence, renowned economic analysts Stephen S. Cohen and J. Bradford DeLong explore the grave consequences this loss will have for AmericaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s place in the world.
America, Cohen and DeLong argue, will no longer be the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s hyperpower. It will no longer wield soft cultural power or dictate a monolithic foreign policy. More damaging, though, is the blow to the worldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s ability to innovate economically, financially, and politically. Cohen and DeLong also explore AmericanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s complicated relationship with China, the misunderstood role of sovereign wealth funds, and the return of state-led capitalism.
An essential read for anyone interested in how global economics and finance interact with national policy, The End of Influence explains the far-reaching and potentially long-lasting but little-noted consequences of our great fiscal crisis.
Genre: Non-Fiction> World Politics & Affairs
